template.name: Template DB Oracle by ODBC
template.description:
1. Create an Oracle user for monitoring.
2. Set the user name and password in host macros ({$ORACLE.USER} and {$ORACLE.PASSWORD}). Do not forget to install the Microsoft ODBC driver on the Zabbix server or the Zabbix proxy. See Oracle documentation for instructions: https://www.oracle.com/database/technologies/releasenote-odbc-ic.html.
Note! Credentials in the odbc.ini do not work for Oracle. Note! Be sure that ODBC connects to Oracle with session parameter NLS_NUMERIC_CHARACTERS= '.,' It is important for correct display float numbers in Zabbix. The "Service's TCP port state" item uses {HOST.CONN} and {$ORACLE.PORT} macros to check the availability of the listener.
Template tooling version used: 0.38

item.name: Oracle: Get archive log info
item.params: SELECT d.dest_name, DECODE (d.status, 'VALID',3, 'DEFERRED', 2, 'ERROR', 1, 0) AS status, d.log_sequence, d.error FROM v$archive_dest d , v$database db WHERE d.status != 'INACTIVE' AND db.log_mode = 'ARCHIVELOG';

item.name: Oracle: Get ASM stats
item.params: SELECT name AS dg_name, ROUND(total_mb / DECODE(TYPE, 'NORMAL', 2, 'HIGH', 3, 'EXTERN', 1)*1024*1024) AS size_byte, ROUND(usable_file_mb*1024*1024 ) AS free_size_byte, ROUND(100-(usable_file_mb /(total_mb / DECODE(TYPE, 'NORMAL', 2, 'HIGH', 3, 'EXTERN', 1)))* 100, 2) AS used_percent FROM v$asm_diskgroup ;
item.description: Get ASM disk groups stats.

item.name: Oracle: Get CDB and No-CDB info
item.params: SELECT name as DBNAME, DECODE(open_mode, 'MOUNTED', 1, 'READ ONLY', 2, 'READ WRITE', 3, 'READ ONLY WITH APPLY', 4, 'MIGRATE', 5, 0) AS open_mode, DECODE(database_role, 'SNAPSHOT STANDBY', 1, 'LOGICAL STANDBY', 2, 'PHYSICAL STANDBY', 3, 'PRIMARY', 4, 'FAR SYNC', 5, 0) AS ROLE, DECODE(force_logging, 'YES',1,'NO',0,0) AS force_logging, DECODE(log_mode, 'MANUAL',2 ,'ARCHIVELOG',1,'NOARCHIVELOG',0,0) AS log_mode FROM v$database
item.description: Get info about CDB and No-CDB databases on instansce.

item.name: Oracle: Get instance state
item.params: SELECT INSTANCE_NAME, HOST_NAME, VERSION || '-' || EDITION AS VERSION, floor((SYSDATE - startup_time)*60*60*24) AS UPTIME, decode(status,'STARTED',1,'MOUNTED',2,'OPEN',3,'OPEN MIGRATE',4, 0) AS STATUS, decode(archiver,'STOPPED',1,'STARTED',2,'FAILED',3, 0) AS ARCHIVER, decode(instance_role,'PRIMARY_INSTANCE',1,'SECONDARY_INSTANCE',2, 0) AS INSTANCE_ROLE FROM v$instance;
item.description: The item gets state of the current instance.

item.name: Oracle: Get PDB info
item.params: SELECT name as DBNAME, DECODE(open_mode, 'MOUNTED', 1, 'READ ONLY', 2, 'READ WRITE', 3, 'READ ONLY WITH APPLY', 4, 'MIGRATE', 5, 0) AS open_mode FROM v$pdbs;
item.description: Get info about PDB databases on instansce.

item.name: Oracle: Get system metrics (1)
item.params: SELECT 'SYS::' || METRIC_NAME AS METRIC, ROUND(VALUE,3) AS VALUE FROM V$SYSMETRIC WHERE GROUP_ID = 2 UNION SELECT 'SYSPARAM::' || INITCAP(NAME), to_number(VALUE) FROM V$SYSTEM_PARAMETER WHERE NAME IN ('sessions', 'processes', 'db_files') UNION SELECT 'SESSION::Long time locked' ,count(*) FROM V$SESSION s WHERE s.BLOCKING_SESSION IS NOT NULL AND s.BLOCKING_SESSION_STATUS='VALID' AND s.SECONDS_IN_WAIT > {$ORACLE.SESSION.LOCK.MAX.TIME} UNION SELECT 'SESSION::Lock rate' ,(cnt_block / cnt_all)* 100 pct FROM ( SELECT COUNT(*) cnt_block FROM v$session WHERE blocking_session IS NOT NULL), ( SELECT COUNT(*) cnt_all FROM v$session) UNION SELECT 'SESSION::Total', COUNT(*) FROM V$SESSION UNION SELECT 'SESSION::' || INITCAP(STATUS)|| ' ' || INITCAP(TYPE), COUNT(*) FROM V$SESSION GROUP BY STATUS, TYPE UNION SELECT 'SESSION::Concurrency rate', NVL(ROUND(SUM(duty_act.cnt*100 / num_cores.val)), 0) FROM ( SELECT DECODE(session_state, 'ON CPU', 'CPU', wait_class) wait_class, ROUND(COUNT(*)/(60 * 15), 1) cnt FROM v$active_session_history sh WHERE sh.sample_time >= SYSDATE - 15 / 1440 AND DECODE(session_state, 'ON CPU', 'CPU', wait_class) IN('Concurrency') GROUP BY DECODE(session_state, 'ON CPU', 'CPU', wait_class)) duty_act, ( SELECT SUM(value) val FROM v$osstat WHERE stat_name = 'NUM_CPU_CORES') num_cores UNION SELECT 'PGA::' || INITCAP(NAME), VALUE FROM V$PGASTAT UNION SELECT 'PROC::Procnum', COUNT(*) FROM v$process UNION SELECT 'DATAFILE::Count', COUNT(*) FROM v$datafile;
item.description: The item gets system metric values.

item.name: Oracle: Get system metrics (2)
item.params: SELECT 'SGA::' || INITCAP(pool) AS METRIC , SUM(bytes) AS VALUE FROM V$SGASTAT WHERE pool IN ( 'java pool', 'large pool' ) GROUP BY pool UNION SELECT 'SGA::Shared Pool', SUM(bytes) FROM V$SGASTAT WHERE pool = 'shared pool' AND name NOT IN ('library cache', 'dictionary cache', 'free memory', 'sql area') UNION SELECT 'SGA::' || INITCAP(name), bytes FROM V$SGASTAT WHERE pool IS NULL AND name IN ('log_buffer', 'fixed_sga') UNION SELECT 'SGA::Buffer_Cache', SUM(bytes) FROM V$SGASTAT WHERE pool IS NULL AND name IN ('buffer_cache', 'db_block_buffers') UNION SELECT 'REDO::Available', count(*) from v$log t where t.status in ('INACTIVE', 'UNUSED') UNION SELECT 'USER::Expire password', ROUND(DECODE(SIGN(NVL(u.expiry_date, SYSDATE + 999) - SYSDATE),-1, 0, NVL(u.expiry_date, SYSDATE + 999) - SYSDATE)) exp_passwd_days_before FROM dba_users u WHERE username = UPPER('{$ORACLE.USER}') UNION SELECT 'FRA::Space Limit', space_limit FROM V$RECOVERY_FILE_DEST UNION SELECT 'FRA::Space Used', space_used FROM V$RECOVERY_FILE_DEST UNION SELECT 'FRA::Space Reclaimable', space_reclaimable FROM V$RECOVERY_FILE_DEST UNION SELECT 'FRA::Number Of Files', number_of_files FROM V$RECOVERY_FILE_DEST UNION SELECT 'FRA::Usable Pct', DECODE(space_limit, 0, 0,(100-(100 *(space_used-space_reclaimable)/ space_limit))) AS VALUE FROM V$RECOVERY_FILE_DEST UNION SELECT 'FRA::Restore Point', COUNT(*) FROM V$RESTORE_POINT;
item.description: The item gets system metric values.

item.name: Oracle: Get tablespaces stats
item.params: SELECT df.tablespace_name AS TABLESPACE, df.type AS TYPE, NVL(SUM(df.BYTES), 0) AS FILE_BYTES, NVL(SUM(df.MAX_BYTES), 0) AS MAX_BYTES, NVL(SUM(f.FREE), 0) AS FREE_BYTES, SUM(df.BYTES)-SUM(f.FREE) AS USED_BYTES, ROUND(DECODE(SUM(df.MAX_BYTES), 0, 0, (SUM(df.BYTES) / SUM(df.MAX_BYTES) * 100)), 2) AS USED_PCT_MAX, ROUND(DECODE(SUM(df.BYTES), 0, 0,(SUM(df.BYTES)-SUM(f.FREE))/ SUM(df.BYTES)* 100), 2) AS USED_FILE_PCT, DECODE(df.STATUS, 'ONLINE', 1, 'OFFLINE', 2, 'READ ONLY', 3, 0) AS STATUS FROM ( SELECT ddf.file_id, dt.contents AS TYPE, dt.STATUS , ddf.file_name, ddf.tablespace_name, TRUNC(ddf.bytes) AS bytes, TRUNC(GREATEST(ddf.bytes, ddf.maxbytes)) AS max_bytes FROM dba_data_files ddf, dba_tablespaces dt WHERE ddf.tablespace_name = dt.tablespace_name ) df, ( SELECT TRUNC(SUM(bytes)) AS FREE, file_id FROM dba_free_space GROUP BY file_id ) f WHERE df.file_id = f.file_id (+) GROUP BY df.tablespace_name, df.TYPE, df.status UNION ALL SELECT Y.name AS TABLESPACE, Y.type AS TYPE, NVL(SUM(Y.BYTES), 0) AS FILE_BYTES, NVL(SUM(Y.MAX_BYTES), 0) AS MAX_BYTES, NVL(MAX(NVL(Y.FREE_BYTES, 0)), 0) AS FREE, SUM(Y.BYTES)-SUM(Y.FREE_BYTES) AS USED_BYTES, ROUND(DECODE(SUM(Y.MAX_BYTES), 0, 0, (SUM(Y.BYTES) / SUM(Y.MAX_BYTES) * 100)), 2) AS USED_PCT_MAX, ROUND(DECODE(SUM(Y.BYTES), 0, 0,(SUM(Y.BYTES)-SUM(Y.FREE_BYTES))/ SUM(Y.BYTES)* 100), 2) AS USED_FILE_PCT, DECODE(Y.TBS_STATUS, 'ONLINE', 1, 'OFFLINE', 2, 'READ ONLY', 3, 0) AS STATUS FROM ( SELECT dtf.tablespace_name AS name, dt.contents AS TYPE, dt.STATUS AS tbs_status, dtf.status AS status, dtf.bytes AS bytes, (SELECT ((f.total_blocks - s.tot_used_blocks)* vp.value) FROM ( SELECT tablespace_name, SUM(used_blocks) tot_used_blocks FROM gv$sort_segment WHERE tablespace_name != 'DUMMY' GROUP BY tablespace_name) s, ( SELECT tablespace_name, SUM(blocks) total_blocks FROM dba_temp_files WHERE tablespace_name != 'DUMMY' GROUP BY tablespace_name) f, ( SELECT value FROM v$parameter WHERE name = 'db_block_size') vp WHERE f.tablespace_name = s.tablespace_name AND f.tablespace_name = dtf.tablespace_name ) AS free_bytes, CASE WHEN dtf.maxbytes = 0 THEN dtf.bytes ELSE dtf.maxbytes END AS max_bytes FROM sys.dba_temp_files dtf, sys.dba_tablespaces dt WHERE dtf.tablespace_name = dt.tablespace_name ) Y GROUP BY Y.name, Y.TYPE, Y.tbs_status;
item.description: Get tablespaces stats.

item.name: Oracle: Service's TCP port state
item.description: Test the availability of Oracle on TCP port.

item.name: Oracle: Active parallel sessions
item.description: The number of active parallel sessions.

item.name: Oracle: Active serial sessions
item.description: The number of active serial sessions.

item.name: Oracle: Average active sessions
item.description: The average active sessions at a point in time. It is the number of sessions that are either working or waiting.

item.name: Oracle: Archiver state
item.description: Automatic archiving status.

item.name: Oracle: Buffer cache hit ratio
item.description: Ratio of buffer cache hits. (LogRead - PhyRead)/LogRead

item.name: Oracle: Global cache blocks corrupted
item.description: The number of blocks that encountered a corruption or checksum failure during interconnect.

item.name: Oracle: Global cache blocks lost
item.description: The number of global cache blocks lost

item.name: Oracle: Cursor cache hit ratio
item.description: Ratio of cursor cache hits. CursorCacheHit/SoftParse

item.name: Oracle: Database CPU time ratio
item.description: Calculated by dividing the total CPU used by the database by the Oracle time model statistic DB time.

item.name: Oracle: Database wait time ratio
item.description: Wait time: the time that the server process spends waiting for available shared resources (to be released by other server processes) such as latches, locks, data buffers, and so on

item.name: Oracle: Datafiles count
item.description: Current number of datafile.

item.name: Oracle: Datafiles limit
item.description: Max allowable number of datafile.

item.name: Oracle: Disk sort per second
item.description: The number of sorts going to disk per second

item.name: Oracle: Enqueue timeouts per second
item.description: Enqueue timeouts per second.

item.name: Oracle: FRA, Number of files
item.description: Number of files in the fast recovery area

item.name: Oracle: FRA, Number of restore points
Oracle: FRA, Space limit
item.description: Maximum amount of disk space (in bytes) that the database can use for the fast recovery area.

item.name: Oracle: FRA, Space reclaimable
item.description: Total amount of disk space (in bytes) that can be created by deleting obsolete, redundant, and other low priority files from the fast recovery area.

item.name: Oracle: FRA, Used space
item.description: Amount of disk space (in bytes) used by fast recovery area files created in current and all previous fast recovery areas.

item.name: Oracle: GC CR block received per second
item.description: GC CR block received per second.

item.name: Oracle: Instance hostname
item.description: Name of the host machine.

trigger.name: Oracle: Instance hostname has changed (new hostname received: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger.description: Oracle DB Instance hostname has changed. Ack to close.

item.name: Oracle: Instance name
item.description: Name of the instance.

trigger.name: Oracle: Instance name has changed (new name received: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger.description: Oracle DB Instance name has changed. Ack to close.

item.name: Oracle: Instance status
item.description: Status of the instance.

item.name: Oracle: Instance role
item.description: Indicates whether the instance is an active instance or an inactive secondary instance.

item.name: Oracle: Library cache hit ratio
item.description: Ratio of library cache hits. Hits/Pins

item.name: Oracle: Logons per second
item.description: The number of logon attempts.

item.name: Oracle: Long table scans per second
item.description: The number of long table scans per second. A table is considered 'long' if the table is not cached and if its high-water mark is greater than 5 blocks.

item.name: Oracle: Memory sorts ratio
item.description: The percentage of sorts (from ORDER BY clauses or index building) that are done to disk vs in-memory.

item.name: Oracle: PGA, Global memory bound
item.description: Maximum size of a work area executed in automatic mode.

item.name: Oracle: PGA, Aggregate target parameter
item.description: Current value of the PGA_AGGREGATE_TARGET initialization parameter. If this parameter is not set, then its value is 0 and automatic management of PGA memory is disabled.

item.name: Oracle: Physical reads bytes per second
item.description: Read bytes per second.

item.name: Oracle: Physical reads per second
item.description: Reads per second.

item.name: Oracle: Physical writes bytes per second
item.description: Write bytes per second.

item.name: Oracle: Physical writes per second
item.description: Writes per second.

item.name: Oracle: Processes limit
item.description: Max user processes.

item.name: Oracle: Redo logs available to switch
item.description: Number of available for log switching inactive/unused REDO logs.

trigger.name: Oracle: Number of REDO logs available for switching is too low (less {$ORACLE.REDO.MIN.WARN} for 5 min)
trigger.description: Number of available for log switching inactive/unused REDOs is low (Database down risk)

item.name: Oracle: Rows per sort
item.description: The average number of rows per sort for all types of sorts performed.

item.name: Oracle: SQL service response time
item.description: SQL service response time in seconds.

item.name: Oracle: Active background sessions
item.description: The number of active background sessions.

item.name: Oracle: Active user sessions
item.description: The number of active user sessions.

item.name: Oracle: Sessions concurrency
item.description: The percentage of concurrency. Concurrency is a DB behaviour when different transactions request to change the same resource - in case of modifying data transactions sequentially block temporarily the right to change data, the rest of the transactions are waiting for access. In the case when access for resource is locked for a long time, then the concurrency grows (like the transaction queue) and this often has an extremely negative impact on performance. A high contention value does not indicate the root cause of the problem, but is a signal to search for it.

trigger.name: Oracle: Too hight database concurrency (over {$ORACLE.CONCURRENCY.MAX.WARN}% for 5 min)
trigger.description: Concurrency rate is over {$ORACLE.CONCURRENCY.MAX.WARN}%. A high contention value does not indicate the root cause of the problem, but is a signal to search for it. In the case of high competition, an analysis of resource consumption should be carried out, the most "heavy" queries made in the database, possibly - session tracing. All this will help determine the root cause and possible optimization points both in the database configuration and in the logic of building queries of the application itself.

item.name: Oracle: Session count
item.description: Session count.

item.name: Oracle: Inactive user sessions
item.description: The number of inactive user sessions.

item.name: Oracle: Sessions limit
item.description: User and system sessions.

item.name: Oracle: Sessions lock rate
item.description: The percentage of locked sessions. Locks are mechanisms that prevent destructive interaction between transactions accessing the same resourceeither user objects such as tables and rows or system objects not visible to users, such as shared data structures in memory and data dictionary rows.

trigger.name: Oracle: Too many locked sessions (over {$ORACLE.SESSIONS.LOCK.MAX.WARN}% for 5 min)
trigger.description: Number of locked sessions is over {$ORACLE.SESSIONS.LOCK.MAX.WARN}% of the running sessions.

item.name: Oracle: Sessions locked over {$ORACLE.SESSION.LOCK.MAX.TIME}s
item.description: Count of the prolongely locked sessions. (You can change maximum session lock duration in seconds for query by {$ORACLE.SESSION.LOCK.MAX.TIME} macro. Default 600 sec)

trigger.name: Oracle: Too many sessions locked over {$ORACLE.SESSION.LOCK.MAX.TIME}s (over {$ORACLE.SESSION.LONG.LOCK.MAX.WARN} for 5 min)
trigger.description: Number of sessions locked over {$ORACLE.SESSION.LOCK.MAX.TIME} seconds is too high. Long-term locks can negatively affect database performance, therefore, if they are detected, you should first find the most difficult queries from the database point of view and analyze possible resource leaks.

item.name: Oracle: SGA, buffer cache
item.description: The size of the cache of standard blocks.

item.name: Oracle: SGA, fixed
item.description: The fixed SGA is an internal housekeeping area.

item.name: Oracle: SGA, java pool
item.description: Memory is allocated from the java pool.

item.name: Oracle: SGA, large pool
item.description: Memory is allocated from the large pool.

item.name: Oracle: SGA, log buffer
item.description: The number of bytes allocated for the redo log buffer.

item.name: Oracle: SGA, shared pool
item.description: Memory is allocated from the shared pool.

item.name: Oracle: Shared pool free %
item.description: Shared pool free memory percent. Free/Total

trigger.name: Oracle: Shared pool free is too low (less {$ORACLE.SHARED.FREE.MIN.WARN}% for 5m)
trigger.description: The shared pool free memory percent has been less than {$ORACLE.SHARED.FREE.MIN.WARN}% in the last 5 minutes.

item.name: Oracle: Total sorts per user call
item.description: Total sorts per user call.

item.name: Oracle: Temp space used
item.description: Temp space used.

item.name: Oracle: PGA, Total allocated
item.description: Current amount of PGA memory allocated by the instance. The Oracle Database attempts to keep this number below the value of the PGA_AGGREGATE_TARGET initialization parameter. However, it is possible for the PGA allocated to exceed that value by a small percentage and for a short period of time when the work area workload is increasing very rapidly or when PGA_AGGREGATE_TARGET is set to a small value.

item.name: Oracle: PGA, Total freeable
item.description: Number of bytes of PGA memory in all processes that could be freed back to the operating system.

item.name: Oracle: PGA, Total inuse
item.description: Indicates how much PGA memory is currently consumed by work areas. This number can be used to determine how much memory is consumed by other consumers of the PGA memory (for example, PL/SQL or Java).

item.name: Oracle: Uptime
item.description: Oracle instance uptime in seconds.

trigger.name: Oracle: Failed to fetch info data (or no data for 5m)
trigger.description: Zabbix has not received data for items for the last 5 minutes. The database might be unavailable for connecting.

dependency.name: Oracle: Port {$ORACLE.PORT} is unavailable
dependency.expression: {Template DB Oracle by ODBC:net.tcp.service[tcp,{HOST.CONN},{$ORACLE.PORT}].max(#3)}=0 and {Template DB Oracle by ODBC:proc.num[,,,"tnslsnr LISTENER"].max(#3)}>0

item.name: Oracle: User '{$ORACLE.USER}' expire password
item.description: The number of days before zabbix account password expired.

trigger.name: Oracle: Zabbix account will expire soon (under {$ORACLE.EXPIRE.PASSWORD.MIN.WARN} days)
trigger.description: Password for zabbix user in the database will expire soon.

item.name: Oracle: User rollbacks per second
item.description: The number of times that users manually issue the ROLLBACK statement or an error occurred during a user's transactions.

item.name: Oracle: Version
item.description: Oracle Server version.

trigger.name: Oracle: Version has changed (new version value received: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger.description: Oracle DB version has changed. Ack to close.

item.name: Oracle: Number of LISTENER processes
item.description: Number of LISTENER processes running

trigger.name: Oracle: LISTENER process is not running

discovery_rule.name: Archive log discovery
discovery_rule.params: SELECT d.dest_name FROM v$archive_dest d , v$database db WHERE d.status != 'INACTIVE' AND db.log_mode = 'ARCHIVELOG';

item_prototype.name: Archivelog '{#DEST_NAME}': Last sequence
item_prototype.description: Identifies the sequence number of the last archived redo log to be archived

item_prototype.name: Archivelog '{#DEST_NAME}': Status
item_prototype.description: Identifies the current status of the destination: 1 - 'Valid', 2 - 'Dederred',3 - 'Error', 0 - 'Unknown'

trigger_prototype.name: Archivelog '{#DEST_NAME}': Log Archive is not valid
trigger_prototype.description: ARL destination not in 3 - Valid or 2 - Deferred.

discovery_rule.name: ASM disk groups discovery
discovery_rule.params: SELECT name AS dg_name FROM v$asm_diskgroup;

item_prototype.name: ASM '{#DG_NAME}': Free size
item_prototype.description: Free size of ASM disk group.

item_prototype.name: ASM '{#DG_NAME}': Total size
item_prototype.description: Total size of ASM disk group.

item_prototype.name: ASM '{#DG_NAME}': Free size
item_prototype.description: Usage percent of ASM disk group.

trigger_prototype.name: ASM '{#DG_NAME}': Disk group usage is too high (over {$ORACLE.ASM.USED.PCT.MAX.WARN}% for 5m)
trigger_prototype.description: Usage percent of ASM disk group is over {$ORACLE.ASM.USED.PCT.MAX.WARN}

dependency.name: ASM '{#DG_NAME}': Disk group usage is too high (over {$ORACLE.ASM.USED.PCT.MAX.HIGH}% for 5m)

trigger_prototype.name: ASM '{#DG_NAME}': Disk group usage is too high (over {$ORACLE.ASM.USED.PCT.MAX.HIGH}% for 5m)
trigger_prototype.description: Usage percent of ASM disk group is over {$ORACLE.ASM.USED.PCT.MAX.WARN}

discovery_rule.name: Database discovery
discovery_rule.params: SELECT name as DBNAME, DECODE(CDB, 'YES', 'CDB', 'No-CDB') AS TYPE FROM V$DATABASE;

item_prototype.name: Oracle Database '{#DBNAME}': Force logging
item_prototype.description: Indicates whether the database is under force logging mode (YES) or not (NO)

item_prototype.name: Oracle Database '{#DBNAME}': Open status
item_prototype.description: 1 - 'MOUNTED', 2 - 'READ WRITE', 3 - 'READ ONLY', 4 - 'READ ONLY WITH APPLY' (A physical standby database is open in real-time query mode)

trigger_prototype.name: Oracle Database '{#DBNAME}': Open status in mount mode
trigger_prototype.description: The Oracle DB has a MOUNTED state.

trigger_prototype.name: Oracle Database '{#DBNAME}': Open status has changed (new value received: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger_prototype.description: Oracle DB open status has changed. Ack to close.

dependency.name: Oracle Database '{#DBNAME}': Open status in mount mode

item_prototype.name: Oracle Database '{#DBNAME}': Role
item_prototype.description: Current role of the database, 1 - 'SNAPSHOT STANDBY', 2 - 'LOGICAL STANDBY', 3 - 'PHYSICAL STANDBY', 4 - 'PRIMARY ', 5 -'FAR SYNC'

trigger_prototype.name: Oracle Database '{#DBNAME}': Role has changed (new value received: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger_prototype.description: Oracle DB role has changed. Ack to close.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template DB Oracle by ODBC:oracle.db_force_logging["{#DBNAME}"].last()} = 0 and {Template DB Oracle by ODBC:oracle.db_log_mode["{#DBNAME}"].last()} = 1
trigger_prototype.name: Oracle Database '{#DBNAME}': Force logging is deactivated for DB with active Archivelog
trigger_prototype.description: Force Logging mode - it is very important metric for Databases in 'ARCHIVELOG'. This feature allows to forcibly write all transactions to the REDO.

discovery_rule.name: PDB discovery
discovery_rule.params: SELECT name as DBNAME FROM V$PDBS;

item_prototype.name: Oracle Database '{#DBNAME}': Open status
item_prototype.description: 1 - 'MOUNTED', 2 - 'READ WRITE', 3 - 'READ ONLY', 4 - 'READ ONLY WITH APPLY' (A physical standby database is open in real-time query mode)

trigger_prototype.name: Oracle Database '{#DBNAME}': Open status in mount mode
trigger_prototype.description: The Oracle DB has a MOUNTED state.

trigger_prototype.name: Oracle Database '{#DBNAME}': Open status has changed (new value received: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger_prototype.description: Oracle DB open status has changed. Ack to close.

discovery_rule.name: Tablespace discovery

item_prototype.name: Oracle TBS '{#TABLESPACE}': Tablespace allocated, bytes
item_prototype.description: Currently allocated bytes for tablespace (sum of the current size of datafiles).

item_prototype.name: Oracle TBS '{#TABLESPACE}': Tablespace MAX size, bytes

trigger_prototype.name: Oracle TBS '{#TABLESPACE}': Tablespase is OFFLINE
trigger_prototype.description: The tablespase is in the offline state.

trigger_prototype.name: Oracle TBS '{#TABLESPACE}': Tablespace status has changed (new value received: {ITEM.VALUE})
trigger_prototype.description: Oracle tablespace status has changed. Ack to close.

item_prototype.name: Oracle TBS '{#TABLESPACE}': Tablespace used, bytes
item_prototype.description: Currently used bytes for tablespace (current size of datafiles-free space).

trigger_prototype.name: Oracle TBS '{#TABLESPACE}': Tablespace usage is too high (over {$ORACLE.TBS.USED.PCT.MAX.WARN}% for 5m).

dependency.name: Oracle TBS '{#TABLESPACE}': Tablespace usage is too high (over {$ORACLE.TBS.USED.PCT.MAX.HIGH}% for 5m).

trigger_prototype.name: Oracle TBS '{#TABLESPACE}': Tablespace usage is too high (over {$ORACLE.TBS.USED.PCT.MAX.HIGH}% for 5m).
Oracle TBS '{#TABLESPACE}': Tablespace utilization is too high (over {$ORACLE.TBS.USED.PCT.MAX.WARN}% for 5m).

dependency.name: Oracle TBS '{#TABLESPACE}': Tablespace utilization is too high (over {$ORACLE.TBS.UTIL.PCT.MAX.HIGH}% for 5m).

trigger_prototype.name: Oracle TBS '{#TABLESPACE}': Tablespace utilization is too high (over {$ORACLE.TBS.UTIL.PCT.MAX.HIGH}% for 5m).

macro.description: Maximum percentage of used ASM disk group for high trigger expression.
Maximum percentage of used ASM disk group for warning trigger expression.
Maximum percentage of sessions concurrency usage for trigger expression.
Maximum percentage of database files for trigger expression.
This macro is used in database discovery. It can be overridden on a host or linked template level.
This macro is used in database discovery. It can be overridden on a host or linked template level.
System data source name
Number of days of warning before password expires (for trigger expression).
Oracle user password.
Maximum percentage of PGA usage alert threshold (for trigger expression).
Oracle DB TCP port.
Maximum percentage of active processes alert threshold (for trigger expression).
Minimum number of REDO logs alert threshold (for trigger expression).
Maximum session lock duration in seconds for count the session as a prolongely locked query.
Maximum number of the prolongely locked sessions alert threshold (for trigger expression).
Maximum percentage of locked sessions alert threshold (for trigger expression).
Maximum percentage of active sessions alert threshold (for trigger expression).
Minimum percentage of free shared pool alert threshold (for trigger expression).
This macro is used in tablespace discovery. It can be overridden on a host or linked template level.
This macro is used in tablespace discovery. It can be overridden on a host or linked template level.
Maximum percentage of used (Used bytes/Allocated bytes) tablespace high severity alert threshold (for trigger expression).
Maximum percentage of used (Used bytes/Allocated bytes) tablespace warning severity alert threshold (for trigger expression).
Maximum percentage of utilization (Allocated bytes/Max bytes) tablespace high severity alert threshold (for trigger expression).
Maximum percentage of utilization (Allocated bytes/Max bytes) tablespace warning severity alert threshold (for trigger expression).
Oracle username.

trigger.expression: {Template DB Oracle by ODBC:net.tcp.service[tcp,{HOST.CONN},{$ORACLE.PORT}].max(#3)}=0 and {Template DB Oracle by ODBC:proc.num[,,,"tnslsnr LISTENER"].max(#3)}>0
trigger.name: Oracle: Port {$ORACLE.PORT} is unavailable
trigger.description: The TCP port of the Oracle Server service is currently unavailable.

trigger.expression: {Template DB Oracle by ODBC:oracle.processes_count.min(5m)} * 100 / {Template DB Oracle by ODBC:oracle.processes_limit.last()} > {$ORACLE.PROCESSES.MAX.WARN}
trigger.name: Oracle: Too many active processes (over {$ORACLE.PROCESSES.MAX.WARN}% for 5 min)
trigger.description: Active processes are using more than {$ORACLE.PROCESSES.MAX.WARN}% of the available number of processes.

trigger.expression: {Template DB Oracle by ODBC:oracle.session_count.min(5m)} * 100 / {Template DB Oracle by ODBC:oracle.session_limit.last()} > {$ORACLE.SESSIONS.MAX.WARN}
trigger.name: Oracle: Too many active sessions (over {$ORACLE.SESSIONS.MAX.WARN}% for 5 min)
trigger.description: Active sessions are using more than {$ORACLE.SESSIONS.MAX.WARN}% of the available sessions.

trigger.expression: {Template DB Oracle by ODBC:oracle.db_files_count.min(5m)} * 100 / {Template DB Oracle by ODBC:oracle.db_files_limit.last()} > {$ORACLE.DB.FILE.MAX.WARN}
trigger.name: Oracle: Too many database files (over {$ORACLE.DB.FILE.MAX.WARN}% for 5 min)
trigger.description: Number of datafiles is higher than {$ORACLE.DB.FILE.MAX.WARN}% of the available datafile files limit.

trigger.expression: {Template DB Oracle by ODBC:oracle.total_pga_used.min(5m)} * 100 / {Template DB Oracle by ODBC:oracle.pga_target.last()} > {$ORACLE.PGA.USE.MAX.WARN}
trigger.name: Oracle: Total PGA inuse is too high (over {$ORACLE.PGA.USE.MAX.WARN}% for 5 min)
trigger.description: Total PGA in use is more than {$ORACLE.PGA.USE.MAX.WARN}% of PGA_AGGREGATE_TARGET.
